categories.description: Fun and educational questions designed specifically for children. These questions are crafted to be engaging and suitable for young minds, encouraging learning through play and exploration.

questions.title: What color is the sun?

What do bees make?

What is the largest ocean in the world?

What do you call a group of lions?
Which planet is closest to the Sun?
What type of tree produces acorns?
What is the name of Mickey Mouse's pet dog?

categories.description: Challenge yourself with questions about scientific facts, discoveries, and theories. Dive into various fields of science, from biology and chemistry to physics and astronomy, and expand your understanding of the natural world.

categories.description: Explore significant historical events, figures, and eras through a range of thought-provoking questions. Delve into ancient civilizations, historical milestones, and influential personalities that have shaped our world.

questions.title: Who was the first President of the United States?
What ancient civilization built the pyramids of Giza?
Which event started World War I?

option.answer: The assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand
The signing of the Treaty of Versailles

What was the primary goal of the Crusades?

Which revolution led to the end of monarchy in France?
Who was the leader of the Indian independence movement against British rule?
Which empire was known for its system of roads and aqueducts?
What was the significance of the Magna Carta?

option.answer: It limited the power of the king

questions.title: Which country was the first to land a human on the moon?
